p: Recently, it was evidenced that crude extracts of some plants present in Japanese macaque ( Macaca fuscata yakui) diet possess antiparasitic activity against same of the most important infectious parasites in humans, such as Trypanosoma brucei rhodesiense, Trypanosoma cruzi, Leishmania donovani, and Plasmodium falciparum. Besides, many of the studied plants are indigenous Asian species used in traditional medicine for various ailments varying from infections (caused by bacteria, fungi, viruses, helminths as well as endo- and ecto-parasites) to allergy, rheumatism, cancer, and more [ 13].
